```{r import library}
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
```

# Bar: Offense Type by Sex, State, and Race

## Bar: Offense Type and Sex

```{r}
ggplot(data     = aggregate_edited, 
       aes(x    = sex, 
           fill = offense_type)) +
  geom_bar()+
  theme(legend.position = "None")
```

## Bar: Offense Type and State
```{r}
ggplot(data     = aggregate_edited,
       aes(x    = state_name, 
           fill = offense_type)) +
  geom_bar() +
  theme(legend.position = "None")
#sort from highest to lowest
```

## Bar: Offense Type and Race
```{r}
ggplot(data     = aggregate_edited, 
       aes(x    = race, 
           fill = offense_type)) +
  geom_bar() +
  theme(legend.position = "None")
```


#Other Plots

## Offense Type by Age

```{r}
ggplot(aggregate_edited, 
       aes(x          = age)) + 
geom_histogram(color  = "darkblue", 
               fill   = "lightblue") + 
geom_vline(xintercept = mean(aggregate_edited$age), 
           linetype   = "dashed", 
           size       = 2, 
           color      = "black")
```


## Time & Crime: Choose An Offense type and See Its prevelence by time

```{r}
aggregate_edited %>%
  mutate(arrest_date) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x        = arrest_date, 
             fill     = offense_type)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 24) +
  scale_x_time()
```
